page.title: 16NUCLEAR CAMPAIGN
page.content: The campaign continued into the New Year of 1985 with a young teenager making a T.V.appearance on behalf of the 141,000 children of{Cleveland.} "I think if we get nuclear waste under our town no one will want to come here and bring new industry. Unless we get new jobs in the area there is no future for the kids here," she explained. At last,to the great joy and relief of the people of Cleveland,15 months after the formation of{BAND}the withdrawal of{NIREX}from{Billingham} was announced in the{House of Commons. The local{M.P's}and the community were praised for a model campaign. The people of Cleveland regained their future!
